Just initialize the variable where you define it.

int burnPercent = 0;

item.source: Give a value to a variable

item.title: Give a value to a variable
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:

Why is it that I can’t give a value to a variable somewhere else in the class. So let’s say we take this:

Then give it a value here:

case 317: //shrimp if (burn == false) { levelS = 35; burnPercent = 75; c.sM("You have successfully cooked the " + c.getItemName(ItemID) + "."); c.deleteItem(317, 1); c.addItem(315, 1); c.setAnimation(883); }

Why, when I put it into this:

if (UsedOnObjectID == 3039) { if (server.misc.random(burnPercent) > levelS - c.playerLevel[7]) { burn = false; } }

The variable may not have been initialized, although I have given it a value in another statement.

Read full topic
item.source: Give a value to a variable
